member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxAcquisition
member.summary: Defines methods for configuring a low-level acquisition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxAcquisition.Dispose
member.summary: Releases the resources used by .
member.remarks: The method leaves the in an unusable state. In an unusable state, you cannot call methods or properties on the object.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxAcquisition.Configure(NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxAcquisitionType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Configures a low-level acquisition.
member.param: Specifies whether the acquisition is or .
For a , this parameter specifies the number of images to acquire. For a continuous acquisition, this parameter specifies the number of buffers the driver uses internally.
member.exception: is less than or equal to zero.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxAcquisition.Start
member.summary: Starts an acquisition that was previously configured with .
member.remarks: Use to stop the acquisition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxAcquisition.Stop
member.summary: Stops an acquisition previously started with .

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxAcquisition.Unconfigure
member.summary: Unconfigures an acquisition previously configured with .

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxAcquisition.GetLastImage(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Acquires the last frame into the image parameter.
member.param: The image that receives the captured pixel data.
member.returns: The image with the captured pixel data.
member.remarks: If the image type does not match the video format of the camera, this method changes the image type to a suitable format. The returned image is the same image you pass in. If is , an image is created and returned.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxAcquisition.GetLastImage(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Acquires the last frame into the image parameter with the specified buffer number.
member.param: The image that receives the captured pixel data.
The actual cumulative buffer number of the image retrieved.
member.returns: The image with the captured pixel data.
member.remarks: If the image type does not match the video format of the camera, this method changes the image type to a suitable format. The returned image is the same image you pass in. If is , an image is created and returned.

member.returns: The image with the captured pixel data.
member.remarks: If the image type does not match the video format of the camera, this method changes the image type to a suitable format.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.Dispose
member.summary: Releases the resources used by .
member.remarks: Call when you are finished using . The method leaves in an unusable state. In an unusable state, you cannot call methods or properties on the object.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.Close
member.summary: Stops an acquisition in progress, releases resources associated with an acquisition, and closes the specified session.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.Snap(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Configures, starts, acquires, stops, and unconfigures a snap acquisition.
member.param: The image that receives the captured pixel data.
member.returns: The image that contains the captured pixel data.
member.remarks: Use a snap for low-speed or single-capture applications where ease of programming is essential. If you call this method before calling , uses cam0 by default. If the image type does not match the video format of the camera, this method changes the image type to a suitable format. The returned image is the same image you pass in. If is , an image is created and returned.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.SnapAsync(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Object)
member.param: An object used to associate client state, such as a task ID, with this particular asynchronous operation.
member.summary: Configures, starts, acquires, stops, and unconfigures an asynchronous snap acquisition.
member.param: The image that receives the captured pixel data.
member.returns: The image that contains the captured pixel data.
member.remarks: Use a snap for low-speed or single-capture applications where ease of programming is essential. If you call this method before calling , uses cam0 by default. If the image type does not match the video format of the camera, this method changes the image type to a suitable format. The returned image is the same image you pass in. If is , an image is created and returned. Use for notification when this operation is done.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.ConfigureGrab
member.summary: Configures and starts an acquisition. A grab performs an acquisition that loops continually on a ring of buffers.
member.remarks: Use a grab for high-speed image acquisition. Use to copy an image out of the buffer. If you call this method before calling , uses cam0 by default. Use to unconfigure the acquisition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.Grab(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Acquires the most current frame into the specified image.
member.param: The image that receives the captured pixel data.
If the value is , the driver will wait for the next available buffer. If the value is , the driver will not wait for the next available buffer, and will instead return the last acquired buffer.
member.returns: The image that contains the captured pixel data.
member.remarks: Call this method only after calling . If the image type does not match the video format of the camera, this method changes the image type to a suitable format. The returned image is the same image you pass in. If is , an image is created and returned.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.Grab(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Boolean,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Acquires the most current frame into the specified image with the specified buffers.
member.param: The image that receives the captured pixel data.
If the value is , the driver will wait for the next available buffer. If the value is , the driver will not wait for the next available buffer, and will instead return the last acquired buffer.
The actual cumulative buffer number of the image retrieved.
member.returns: The image that contains the captured pixel data.
member.remarks: Call this method only after calling . If the image type does not match the video format of the camera, this method changes the image type to a suitable format. The returned image is the same image you pass in. If is , an image is created and returned.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.GrabAsync(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Acquires the most current frame into the specified image asynchronously.
member.param: The image that receives the captured pixel data.
If the value is , the driver will wait for the next available buffer. If the value is , the driver will not wait for the next available buffer, and will instead return the last acquired buffer.
An object used to associate client state, such as a task ID, with this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: The image that contains the captured pixel data.
member.remarks: Use for notification when the operation is done. Call this method only after calling . If the image type does not match the video format of the camera, this method changes the image type to a suitable format. The returned image is the same image you pass in. If is , an image is created and returned.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.Sequence(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Configures, starts, acquires, stops, and unconfigures a sequence acquisition.
member.param: The image array that receives the captured pixel data.
The number of images in the image array. This value must be less than or equal to the number of allocated images in the image array.
member.returns: The image array that contains the captured pixel data.
member.exception: is less than or equal to 0.
member.remarks: Use this method to capture multiple images. If you call this method before calling , uses cam0 by default. If the image type does not match the video format of the camera, this method changes the image type to a suitable format. The returned image is the same image you pass in. If is , an image is created and returned. If the length of the images array you pass in is different than , an array the size of is created.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.SequenceAsync(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage[],System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Configures, starts, acquires, stops, and unconfigures a sequence acquisition asynchronously.
member.param: The image array that receives the captured pixel data.
An object used to associate client state, such as a task ID, with this particular asynchronous operation.
The number of images in the image array. This value must be less than or equal to the number of allocated images in the image array.
member.returns: The image array that contains the captured pixel data.
member.exception: is less than or equal to 0.
member.remarks: Use this method to capture multiple images. If you call this method before calling , uses cam0 by default. If the image type does not match the video format of the camera, this method changes the image type to a suitable format. The returned image is the same image you pass in. If is , an image is created and returned. If the length of the images array you pass in is different than , an array the size of is created. Use for notification when this operation is done.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.WriteRegister(System.UInt64,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Accesses registers on the camera and writes a 32-bit value to the camera. Data is byte-swapped for big endian alignment before transfer.
member.param: The register location to access. Refer to the camera documentation for more information about camera-specific register ranges. Use attribute to obtain the base address for the camera.
Specifies the value to write to the memory offset.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.ReadRegister(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Accesses registers on the camera and reads a 32-bit value from the camera. Data is byte-swapped for little endian alignment after transfer.
member.param: The register location to access. Refer to the camera documentation for more information about camera-specific register ranges.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.WriteMemory(System.UInt64,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Accesses registers on the camera and writes a string to the camera.
member.param: The register location to access. Refer to the camera documentation for more information about camera-specific register ranges. Use attribute to obtain the base address for the camera.
Specifies the string to write to the memory offset.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSession.ReadMemory(System.UInt64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Accesses registers on the camera and reads a string from the camera.
member.param: The register location to access. Refer to the camera documentation for more information about camera-specific register ranges.
Specifies the maximum length of the string read from the memory offset.
member.exception: is less than or equal to 0.

member.summary: Converts the value of this instance to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxEthernetSession.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified camera.
member.param: The name of the camera.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxEthernetSession.#ctor(System.String,NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxCameraControlMode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified camera and mode.
member.param: The name of the camera.
The control mode of the camera used during image broadcasting.
member.remarks: Open a camera in mode to actively configure and acquire image data. Open a camera in mode to passively acquire image data from a session that was opened in mode on a different host or target computer. The default value is .

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxEthernetSession.ResetEthernetCameraAddress(System.String,System.Net.IPAddress,System.Net.IPAddress,System.Net.IPAddress,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reset Ethernet camera address.
member.param:
The name of the camera you want to open. must match the configuration file name you used to configure the camera in MAX. You can also open a camera using its 64-bit serial number (uuid:XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX), where the number following uuid must be a 64-bit hexadecimal number representing the internal serial number of the camera.
Specify uuid:serial number in hexadecimal representation for the camera name when opening in listening mode. The serial number must match the serial number used in MAX.
Network address for the camera.
Subnet mask for the camera.
Gateway for the camera.
Time, in milliseconds, allowed for the Ethernet camera to reset its network address. The default timeout is 1000 ms.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxEthernetSession.DiscoverEthernetCameras(System.Net.IPAddress,System.Int32)
member.summary: Detects Ethernet cameras on a network.
member.param: Specifies the destination address for the discovery command. The default address is 255.255.255.255.
Specifies the time, in milliseconds, allowed for the Ethernet camera discovery to complete. The default timeout is 1000 ms.
member.remarks: Use this method to detect Ethernet cameras on a network with a remote subnet. During discovery, this method is blocked and returns after the specified timeout. The address specifies the destination address for the discovery command. The default address is 255.255.255.255.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.LostPacketCount
member.summary: The number of lost packets during an acquisition session.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.RequestedResendPacketCount
member.summary: The number of packets requested to be resent during an acquisition session.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.ReceivedResendPackets
member.summary: The number of packets that were requested to be resent during an acquisition session and were completed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.HandledEventCount
member.summary: The number of handled events during an acquisition session.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.LostEventCount
member.summary: The number of lost events during an acquisition session.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.BayerGainB
member.summary: The white balance gain for the blue component of the Bayer conversion.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.BayerGainG
member.summary: The white balance gain for the green component of the Bayer conversion.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.BayerGainR
member.summary: The white balance gain for the red component of the Bayer conversion.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.BayerPattern
member.summary: The Bayer pattern to use.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.StreamChannelMode
member.summary: The mode for allocating a FireWire stream channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.DesiredStreamChannel
member.summary: The stream channel to manually allocate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.FrameInterval
member.summary: The duration in milliseconds between successive frames.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.IgnoreFirstFrame
member.summary: The video delay of one frame between starting the camera and receiving the video feed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.OffsetX
member.summary: The left offset of the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.OffsetY
member.summary: The top offset of the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.Width
member.summary: The width of the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.Height
member.summary: The height of the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.PixelFormat
member.summary: The pixel format of the source sensor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.PacketSize
member.summary: The packet size in bytes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.PayloadSize
member.summary: The frame size in bytes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.Speed
member.summary: The transfer speed in Mbps for a FireWire packet.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.ShiftPixelBits
member.summary: The alignment of 16-bit cameras. Downshift the pixel bits if the camera returns most significant bit-aligned data.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.SwapPixelBytes
member.summary: The endianness of 16-bit cameras. Swap the pixel bytes if the camera returns little endian data.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.OverwriteMode
member.summary: The overwrite mode used to determine acquisition when an image transfer cannot be completed due to an overwritten internal buffer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.Timeout
member.summary: The timeout value in milliseconds, used to abort an acquisition when the image transfer cannot be completed within the delay.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.VideoMode
member.summary: The video mode for a camera.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: The actual bits per pixel. For 16-bit components, this represents the actual bit depth (10-, 12-, 14-, or 16-bit).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.PixelSignedness
member.summary: The signedness of the pixel. For 16-bit components, this represents the actual pixel signedness (Signed, or Unsigned).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.ReserveDualPackets
member.summary: Whether dual packets will be reserved for a very large FireWire packet.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.ReceiveTimestampMode
member.summary: The mode for timestamping images received by the driver.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.ActualPeakBandwidth
member.summary: The actual maximum peak bandwidth the camera will be configured to use.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.DesiredPeakBandwidth
member.summary: The desired maximum peak bandwidth the camera should use.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.DestinationMode
member.summary: Location where the camera is instructed to send the image stream.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.DestinationMulticastAddress
member.summary: The multicast address the camera should send data in multicast mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.MaxOutstandingEvents
member.summary: The maximum number of outstanding events to queue.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.LostPacketMode
member.summary: The behavior when the user extracts a buffer that has missing packets.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.MemoryWindowSize
member.summary: The size of the memory window of the camera in kilobytes. Should match the camera's internal buffer size.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.ResendsEnabled
member.summary: Resends issued for missing packets.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.ResendThresholdPercentage
member.summary: The threshold of the packet processing window that will trigger packets to be resent.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.ResendBatchingPercentage
member.summary: The percent of the packet resend threshold that will be issued as one group past the initial threshold sent in a single request.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.MaxResendsPerPacket
member.summary: The time to wait for a resend request to be satisfied before sending another.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.ResendResponseTimeout
member.summary: The time to wait for a resend request to be satisfied before sending another.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.NewPacketTimeout
member.summary: The time to wait for new packets to arrive in a partially completed image before assuming the rest of the image was lost.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.MissingPacketTimeout
member.summary: The time to wait for a missing packet before issuing a resend.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStandardAttribute.ResendTimerResolution
member.summary: The resolution of the packet processing system that is used for all packet-related timeouts.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStringAttribute
member.summary: Defines string camera attributes.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxStringAttribute.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value as a string for the current attribute.
member.value: The current value as a string.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSystem
member.summary: Provides methods for camera information and resetting cameras.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSystem.Reset(System.String)
member.summary: Performs a manual reset on a camera. Stops any ongoing acquisitions.
member.param: The name of the camera you want to reset. (cam0, cam1, ..., camN) must match the configuration file name you used to configure the camera in MAX. You can also open a camera using its 64-bit serial number (uuid:XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX), where the number following uuid must be a 64-bit hexadecimal number representing the internal serial number of the camera.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSystem.ResetAll
member.summary: Performs a manual reset on all connected cameras. Stops any ongoing acquisitions.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxSystem.GetCameraInformation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a list of all cameras on the host computer.
member.param: If is , then the cameraInformationArray only contains cameras that are currently connected to the host computer. If is , then the cameraInformationArray contains cameras that are currently connected, and were previously connected, to the host computer.
member.returns: A list of all cameras on the host computer.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxUInt32Attribute
member.summary: Defines unsigned 32-bit integer camera attributes.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxUInt32Attribute.Minimum
member.summary: Gets the current minimum as an integer for the active attribute.
member.value: The minimum value for the active attribute.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxUInt32Attribute.Maximum
member.summary: Gets the current maximum as an integer for the active attribute.
member.value: The maximum value for the active attribute.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxUInt32Attribute.Increment
member.summary: Gets the increment as an integer for the active attribute.
member.value: The increment for the active attribute.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaqdx.ImaqdxUInt32Attribute.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value as an unsigned 32-bit integer for the current attribute.
member.value: The current value for the attribute.
